trans-unit.source: Provides access to properties and values of the ticket used with forms authentication to identify users.
This class cannot be inherited.

The <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsAuthenticationTicket> class is used to create an object that represents the authentication ticket that is used by forms authentication to identify an authenticated user.
The properties and values of a forms-authentication ticket are converted to and from an encrypted string that is stored in a cookie or in the URL.

The <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsAuthentication> class provides an <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsAuthentication.Encrypt%2A> method to create a string value that can be stored in a cookie or in the URL from a <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsAuthenticationTicket>.

The <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsAuthentication> class also provides a <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsAuthentication.Decrypt%2A> method to create a <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsAuthenticationTicket> object from the encrypted authentication ticket retrieved from the forms-authentication cookie or the URL.

The <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsAuthenticationTicket> for the current authenticated user can be accessed using the <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsIdentity.Ticket%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsIdentity> class.

You can access the current <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsIdentity> object by casting the <xref:System.Security.Principal.IPrincipal.Identity%2A> property of the current <xref:System.Web.HttpContext.User%2A> as type <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsIdentity>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Security.FormsAuthenticationTicket"></xref> class using a cookie name and expiration information.

The <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsAuthenticationTicket> object created by this constructor will have a <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsAuthenticationTicket.CookiePath%2A> value set to the value of the <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsAuthentication.FormsCookiePath%2A> property, a <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsAuthenticationTicket.Version%2A> value of 2, an <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsAuthenticationTicket.IssueDate%2A> value of the current local date and time, a <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsAuthenticationTicket.UserData%2A> value of an empty string (""), and an <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsAuthenticationTicket.Expiration%2A> value that is set to the current local date and time plus the value of the `timeout` parameter.
The user name associated with the ticket.
`true` if the ticket will be stored in a persistent cookie (saved across browser sessions); otherwise, `false`.
If the ticket is stored in the URL, this value is ignored.
The time, in minutes, for which the authentication ticket is valid.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Security.FormsAuthenticationTicket"></xref> class with cookie name, version, expiration date, issue date, persistence, and user-specific data.
The cookie path is set to the default value established in the application's configuration file.

The <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsAuthenticationTicket> object created by this constructor will have a <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsAuthenticationTicket.CookiePath%2A> value set to the value of the <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsAuthentication.FormsCookiePath%2A>.
The `userData` parameter cannot be `null`.
The version number of the ticket.
The user name associated with the ticket.
The local date and time at which the ticket was issued.
The local date and time at which the ticket expires.
`true` if the ticket will be stored in a persistent cookie (saved across browser sessions); otherwise, `false`.
If the ticket is stored in the URL, this value is ignored.
The user-specific data to be stored with the ticket.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Security.FormsAuthenticationTicket"></xref> class with cookie name, version, directory path, issue date, expiration date, persistence, and user-defined data.
The `userData` parameter cannot be `null`.
The version number of the ticket.
The user name associated with the ticket.
The local date and time at which the ticket was issued.
The local date and time at which the ticket expires.
`true` if the ticket will be stored in a persistent cookie (saved across browser sessions); otherwise, `false`.
If the ticket is stored in the URL, this value is ignored.
The user-specific data to be stored with the ticket.
The path for the ticket when stored in a cookie.
Gets the cookie path for the forms-authentication ticket.

If the <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsAuthenticationTicket> is created using a constructor that does not supply a `cookiePath` parameter, the <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsAuthenticationTicket.CookiePath%2A> property returns the value of the <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsAuthentication.FormsCookiePath%2A> property; otherwise, the version property returns the value supplied to the <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsAuthenticationTicket> constructor.
The cookie path for the forms-authentication ticket.
Gets the local date and time at which the forms-authentication ticket expires.

If the <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsAuthenticationTicket> is created using the <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsAuthenticationTicket.%23ctor%28System.String%2CSystem.Boolean%2CSystem.Int32%29> constructor that does not supply a parameter for an expiration date and time, the <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsAuthenticationTicket.Expiration%2A> property returns a value based on the current local date and time plus the value of the `timeout` parameter supplied to the constructor.

If the <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsAuthenticationTicket> was created using a constructor that takes an `expiration` parameter, the <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsAuthenticationTicket.Expiration%2A> property returns the value supplied to the `expiration` parameter.
The <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> at which the forms-authentication ticket expires.
Gets a value indicating whether the forms-authentication ticket has expired.

The <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsAuthenticationTicket.Expired%2A> property returns `true` if the <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsAuthenticationTicket.Expiration%2A> date and time is less than the current local date and time; otherwise, the <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsAuthenticationTicket.Expired%2A> property returns `false`.
`true` if the forms-authentication ticket has expired; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value indicating whether the cookie that contains the forms-authentication ticket information is persistent.
`true` if a durable cookie (a cookie that is saved across browser sessions) was issued; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the local date and time at which the forms-authentication ticket was originally issued.
The <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsAuthenticationTicket.IssueDate%2A> property represents the local date and time when the forms-authentication ticket was issued.

The <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsAuthentication.RenewTicketIfOld%2A> method uses the <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsAuthenticationTicket.IssueDate%2A> property value to determine whether the <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsAuthenticationTicket.Expiration%2A> date and time of a forms-authentication ticket needs to be renewed and also uses the <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsAuthenticationTicket.IssueDate%2A> property value to determine the new <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsAuthenticationTicket.Expiration%2A> date and time.
When a ticket is renewed, the <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsAuthenticationTicket.IssueDate%2A> property is updated to the local date and time.
The <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> when the forms-authentication ticket was originally issued.
Gets the user name associated with the forms-authentication ticket.
The user name associated with the forms-authentication ticket.
Gets a user-specific string stored with the ticket.

If the <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsAuthenticationTicket> is created using a constructor that does not supply a `userData` parameter, the <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsAuthenticationTicket.UserData%2A> property returns an empty string (""); otherwise, the version property returns the value supplied to the <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsAuthenticationTicket> constructor.

You can use the <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsAuthenticationTicket.UserData%2A> property to store additional user information with the <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsAuthenticationTicket> that is not maintained by the <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsAuthenticationTicket> property values.
You should limit the amount of data stored in the <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsAuthenticationTicket.UserData%2A> property.
You must ensure that the size of the <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsAuthenticationTicket.UserData%2A> property does not result in an invalid cookie or an excessively long URL.
A user-specific string stored with the ticket.
The default is an empty string ("").
Gets the version number of the ticket.

If the <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsAuthenticationTicket> is created using a constructor that does not supply a `version` parameter, the <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsAuthenticationTicket.Version%2A> property returns 2; otherwise, the version property returns the value supplied to the <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsAuthenticationTicket> constructor.
The version number of the ticket.
The default is 2.
